column1: Brushy Creek is a census-designated place (CDP) in Williamson County

column3: just west of Round Rock along the shore of Brushy Creek.

column1: According to the United States Census Bureau in 2000
column2: the CDP has a total area of 8.7 square miles (22.6 km2)
column3: all of it land. Prior to the 2010 census
column4: the CDP had parts annexed to the cities of Austin and Round Rock and lost additional area
column5: reducing its total area of 7.0 square miles (18 km2)
column7: 6.93 square miles (17.9 km2) of it is land and 0.07 square miles (0.18 km2) is water.

column15: and 2.09% from two or more races. Hispanic or Latino of any race were 10.23% of the population.

column1: Much of the CDP is in the Round Rock Independent School District while some portions are in the Leander Independent School District.Elementary schools serving RRISD sections of Brushy Creek include Brushy Creek
column5: and Sommer. Middle schools serving RRISD sections include Cedar Valley
column8: and James Garland Walsh. Some RRISD portions are zoned to Round Rock High School and others are zoned to McNeil High School.Leander ISD sections are zoned to Akin Elementary School
